raw_text: POS tagger in this work, we note that taggers optimized specifically for social media are now available and would likely have resulted in higher tagging accuracy (e.g. Owoputi et al (2013)) .6Note that while our target gender task presents mutually exclusive output classes, we can still train classifiers for other categories without clear opposites (e.g. for labeling users as Parents or Doctors) by using the 1-class classification paradigm (Koppel and Schler, 2004)
clean_text: POS tagger in this work, we note that taggers optimized specifically for social media are now available and would likely have resulted in higher tagging accuracy (e.g. Owoputi et al (2013)).

citing_paper_authors: Dirk, Hovy | Barbara, Plank | Anders, SÃ¸gaard
raw_text: To test this, we train a CRF model (Lafferty et al, 2001) with simple orthographic features and word clusters (Owoputi et al, 2013) 4http: //www.isi.edu/publications/licensed-sw/mace/on the annotated Twitter data described in Gimpel et al (2011)
clean_text: To test this, we train a CRF model (Lafferty et al, 2001) with simple orthographic features and word clusters (Owoputi et al, 2013) on the annotated Twitter data described in Gimpel et al (2011).

citing_paper_authors: Dirk, Hovy | Barbara, Plank | Anders, SÃ¸gaard
raw_text: For NER, we use standard features, including POS tags (from the previous experiments), indicators for hyphens, digits, single quotes ,upper/lowercase, 3-character prefix and suffix information, and Brown word cluster features 6 with 2,4,8,16 bit string prefixes estimated from a large Twitter corpus (Owoputi et al, 2013)
clean_text: For NER, we use standard features, including POS tags (from the previous experiments), indicators for hyphens, digits, single quotes, upper/lowercase, 3-character prefix and suffix information, and Brown word cluster features 6 with 2,4,8,16 bit string prefixes estimated from a large Twitter corpus (Owoputi et al, 2013).

citing_paper_authors: Sandeep, Soni | Tanushree, Mitra | Eric, Gilbert | Jacob, Eisenstein
raw_text: We use the CMU Twitter Part-of-Speech Tagger (Owoputi et al, 2013) to select only instances in the verb sense
clean_text: We use the CMU Twitter Part-of-Speech Tagger (Owoputi et al, 2013) to select only instances in the verb sense.

citing_paper_authors: Jiwei, Li | Alan, Ritter | Eduard, Hovy
raw_text: Part-of speech tags are assigned based on Owoputi et als tweet POS system (Owoputi et al, 2013)
clean_text: Part-of-speech tags are assigned based on Owoputi et al's tweet POS system (Owoputi et al, 2013).
